CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1958, pg. 1 reads: "Republicans Urge Equal Rights for All Citizens in Campaign Platform for '58 - Five Top Candidates - Prior to the 10 o'clock meeting last Saturday morning, the five top Republican candidates discussed campaign strategy at breakfast in Hotel Webster Hall. Right to left [left to right] are candidates Robert E. Woodside, for Supreme Court; John M. Walker, for Lieutenant-Governor; Arthur T. McGonigle, for Governor; Hugh Scott, for U.S. Senate, and Andrew J. Gleason, for Secretary of Internal Affairs." Portion of accompanying article reads: "The Republican State Committee met at Hotel Webster Hall last Saturday morning and adopted a campaign platform pledging equal rights for all Pennsylvania citizens in the fields of education, employment, organized labor and housing..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Arthur T. McGonigle wearing satin necktie and striped suit jacket with light colored handkerchief in left breast pocket and pin on left lapel, standing in front of table with hat in Webster Hall
